result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF206 & #15CF220 called at 10:07am. 
Defendant Jesus  Garza in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. Garza makes a statement.


In Case #15CF206-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Garza to 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 years &  6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

The Court finds that Mr. Garza is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Garza is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 251 days credit for time already served.


In Case #15CF220-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Garza to 2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #15CF206.
The Court finds that Mr. Garza is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Garza is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 251 days credit for time already served.


The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision in both cases:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--
no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to commit any acts of violence or make any threats 
--to pay all outstanding court financial obligations 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence forms given to the Defendant
recess 10:35am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesus Garza
Current: 1300 Lange Ct, c/o Sauk County Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 12-05-2016)
Prior: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States
Sent to Defendant for Cases 15CF220 & 15CF206 (1)NOH for 11/6/15 STC (2)NOH for 11/6/15 Bail/Bond Hearing//Defendant in Custody

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Cases 15CF206 & 15CF220 called together at 9:20 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for BBH & STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jesus  Garza in court, in-custody, with Attorney Teri M. Strohschein. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CF206 & Count #1-15CF220; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining charges

On Count #1-15CF206 & Count #1-15CF220, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--Submit to any psychological evaluation/testing as directed by DOC
--No acts/threats of violence
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No direct/indirect contact with R.A. unless previoulsy approved by DOC & R.A.'s parents
--Make honest and legitimate attempts to obtain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
 and pay attending surcharge
--No restitution
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physicians

Days credit for time already served: 26 days
 - 15CF206
Days credit for time already served: 26 days - 15CF220
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court finds the Defendant is not eligible for expungement
Assuming there are no other holds against the Defendant, his release is authorized
Recess: 9:50 am
Letter from Attorney Strohschein ref representation

Cases 15CF206 & 15CF220 called together at 2:14 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesus  Garza in court, in-custody, with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Luchsinger: Mr. Garza has retained private counsel - Atty Strohschein was here earlier, but had another hearing on juvenile matter
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Luchsinger informs the Court that Atty Strohschein has confirmed willingness to take over cases
Court grants substitution and relieves Atty Luchsinger of his duties on these matters
Recess: 2:17 pm

NEXT:  BOTH CASES (1) Schedule STC 11/6/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
Second letter from the defendant requesting bond modification
Letter from the defendant requesting bond modification

Cases 15CF206 and 15CF220 called together at 1:27pm [mo]
[Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II]

Defendant Jesus Garza appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Svehlek gives reasoning for Mr. Garza's non-appearance 
Bond arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 15CF206:
The Court requires a $5,000 CASH bond, with same non monetary conditions as previously set

As to Case 15CF220:
The Court requires a $750 CASH bond, with same non monetary conditions as previously set
recess 1:34 pm. 


NEXT: Status Conference on 10/27/15 at 2:00pm (attorney of record, Attorney Luchsinger is to be notified)
Sent to Defendant (1) Notice of Bail/ Bond Forfeiture for Case 15CF220 (2)Notice of Bail/ Bond Forfeiture for Case 15CF206//sent to LKA

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #15CF206 and #15CF220 called at 1:49pm 
Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that he does not have any information about Mr. Garza's non-appearance. 
As to both cases the Court orders issuance of a Capias and orders forfeiture of the Bond.
recess 1:50pm
NOH's for both Cases 15CF206 & 15CF220 1) PTC 9/9/15 & 2) STC 9/25/15//sent to LKA
NOH for Def. for 7/24/15 Preliminary Hrg.//sent to LKA; Def. did appear

Cases 15CF206 & 15CF220 called together at 8:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jesus Garza in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH CASES: 
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Garza  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:48 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/9/15 at 1:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 9/25/15 at 1:30 pm- Send notices

[MK] case called at 1:50pm. 
Defendant Jesus Garza appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Garza verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct; he indicates that he does not have a telephone number to provide.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court schedules the Preliminary Hearing on July 24th, when the Preliminary Hearing on the underlying case is already scheduled. 

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with the minor, R.A. 
recess 1:53pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on  July 24, 2015 at 8:30 am
